docTitle.titlePart:
Experimental and Molecular Therapeutics 34: Receptor
Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitors
Abstract #4038
E7080, an oral multitargeted tyrosine kinase
inhibitor, has direct anti-tumor efficacy via
inhibition of KIT signaling in gastrointestinal
stromal tumor (GIST)

byline.docAuthor:
Yuji Yamamoto, Tatsuo Watanabe, Akihiko Tsuruoka,
Toshiaki Wakabayashi and Makoto Asada

front.div:
Most gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GIST) express constitutively active forms of the receptor tyrosine
kinase KIT, derived from oncogenic mutation in the extracullular, juxtamembrane, or kinase domains.
Constitutively activated KIT signaling induces tumor growth and the tumor malignant phenotype of GIST.
Glivec (Imatinib mesylate, STI571) which inhibits the kinase activity of KIT, has been therapeutically
effective in patients with GIST. E7080 is an oral multitargeted tyrosine kinase inhibitor against KDR
(VEGFR-2), Flt-1 (VEGFR-1), FGFR1 and PDGFRbeta with IC50 values of 5 -50 nM in cell free kinase
assays. E7080 also inhibits KIT with an IC50 value of 100 nM. We evaluated the effect of E7080 on KIT
activity in GIST cell line. Treatment of GIST882 with E7080 resulted in dose-dependent inhibition of cell
proliferation, with an IC50 value of 35 nM. E7080 inhibited KIT tyrosine phosphorylation in GIST882 in a
dose-dependent manner, with an IC50 values of 200 nM. E7080 also inhibited downstream events
following KIT activation including ERK1/2 and Akt phosphorylation in a dose-dependent manner, with
IC50 values consistent with that observed for the inhibition of KIT phosphorylation. Anti-tumor efficacy
of E7080 in a GIST882 xenograft model also was evaluated. Oral administration of E7080 at doses of 30
or 100 mg/kg (BID, QDx28) caused tumor dormancy. E7080 at a dose of 100 mg/kg resulted in tumor
shrinkage that measured approximately 40%, even when treatment was initiated following significant
tumor growth. The status of KIT activation was examined in GIST882 tumors resected after 2 h treatment
with E7080. E7080 clearly reduced phospho-KIT levels in GIST882 tumors. Soluble KIT (s-KIT) was
evaluated as a potential biomarker of E7080 in the GIST882 xenograft model, because it has been
reported that s-KIT in plasma samples could be used as a biomarker for therapeutic efficacy in patients
E7080, an oral multitargeted tyrosine kinase inhibitor, has direct anti-tu...
